portfolio.summary: Live overview of every client journey from first intake to production-ready script.

artifact.name: Creative Brief
artifact.summary: Living version-controlled brief ready for client feedback.

steps.name: Intake Summary
steps.description: Upload call notes, emails, and transcripts so the AI can highlight the throughline.
steps.aiSupport: Parses raw sources into a structured summary and flags inconsistencies.
steps.humanFocus: Capture every source, tag it, and sanity-check the generated outline.

steps.name: Clarify the Brief
steps.description: Work through clarifying probes to close gaps before presenting the strategy.
steps.aiSupport: Generates follow-up questions based on what's missing in the summary.
steps.humanFocus: Log answers, assign owners, and resolve blockers.

steps.name: Audience Personas
steps.description: Coach the AI to spin personas from the brief before making manual tweaks.
steps.aiSupport: Pulls from the intake summary and answered probes, applies coaching notes, and remembers rejected directions as the brief shifts.
steps.humanFocus: Drop guidance like in Clarify the Brief, review the AI draft, and only hand-edit for polish.

steps.name: Research Prompt Kit
steps.description: Launch ready-to-use prompts for deeper market or audience research.
steps.aiSupport: Transforms the current brief into channel-specific prompts.
steps.humanFocus: Queue prompts, capture outputs, and log insights.

artifact.name: Concept Boards
artifact.summary: Set of versioned concept boards that storytell the campaign vision.

steps.name: Concept Explorer
steps.description: Spin up multiple loglines from the approved brief and shortlist the strongest ideas.
steps.aiSupport: Suggests differentiated angles and reframes based on audience goals.
steps.humanFocus: Score viability, pick 2-3 concepts, and brief revisions.

steps.name: AI Creative Director
steps.description: Stress-test each concept board before it goes in front of the client.
steps.aiSupport: Provides constructive critique and anticipates client pushback.
steps.humanFocus: Integrate feedback, duplicate versions, and prep talking points.

artifact.name: Shooting Script
artifact.summary: Production-ready script annotated with cues for every department.

steps.name: Scene Outline
steps.description: Lay out the scene-by-scene roadmap before diving into dialogue.
steps.aiSupport: Suggests pacing adjustments and coverage notes.
steps.humanFocus: Lock structure and confirm pacing with stakeholders.

steps.name: Draft & Iterate
steps.description: Draft the script, run targeted rewrites, and capture revision history.
steps.aiSupport: Supports punch-ups, tonal rewrites, and production cue insertion.
steps.humanFocus: Approve final lines, mark revisions, and log change rationale.

projects.name: Aurora Spring Launch
projects.summary: Reposition Aurora's smart lighting as the effortless way to refresh any home for spring.

artifact.name: Creative Brief
artifact.summary: v1.1 draft outlines objectives, audience, and positioning for the spring campaign.

steps.name: Intake Summary
steps.description: Upload call notes, emails, and transcripts so the AI can highlight the throughline.
steps.aiSupport: Parses raw sources into a structured summary and flags inconsistencies.
steps.humanFocus: Capture every source, tag it, and sanity-check the generated outline.
steps.notes: Waiting on clarification about budget flexibility.
steps.next: Add new client feedback from Thursday's call.

steps.name: Clarify the Brief
steps.description: Work through clarifying probes to close gaps before presenting the strategy.
steps.aiSupport: Generates follow-up questions based on what's missing in the summary.
steps.humanFocus: Log answers, assign owners, and resolve blockers.
steps.notes: Two questions still awaiting client response.
steps.next: Email revised probes to Jenna for Monday call.

steps.name: Audience Personas
steps.description: Coach the AI to spin personas from the brief before making manual tweaks.
steps.aiSupport: Pulls from the intake summary and answered probes, applies coaching notes, and remembers rejected directions as the brief shifts.
steps.humanFocus: Drop guidance like in Clarify the Brief, review the AI draft, and only hand-edit for polish.
steps.notes: Personas approved but tone needs to reflect more pragmatism.
steps.next: Tighten 'Primary Buyer' motivations before sharing with client.

steps.name: Research Prompt Kit
steps.description: Launch ready-to-use prompts for deeper market or audience research.
steps.aiSupport: Transforms the current brief into channel-specific prompts.
steps.humanFocus: Queue prompts, capture outputs, and log insights.
steps.next: Run competitor scan once client approves v1.1 brief.

sources.title: Initial Discovery Call
sources.summary: Client wants to move beyond 'smart tech' positioning toward 'seasonal mood'.
sources.contentPreview: Priority is showing ease of switching moods. Need to feature voice presets.
sources.raw: Priority is showing ease of switching moods. Need to feature voice presets.

sources.title: Follow-Up Priorities
sources.summary: Clarified KPIs and must-have deliverables for the board.
sources.contentPreview: Primary KPI is 18% uplift in bundle sales vs Q1. TV + paid social assets required.
sources.raw: Primary KPI is 18% uplift in bundle sales vs Q1. TV + paid social assets required.

sources.title: Competitive Scan Highlights
sources.summary: Market flooded with tech-first language. No one owns 'seasonal refresh' territory.
sources.contentPreview: Most competitors focus on wattage and integrations. Opportunity: emotional storytelling.
sources.raw: Most competitors focus on wattage and integrations. Opportunity: emotional storytelling.

summary: Aurora wants to unlock an emotional hook around 'refresh your home mood effortlessly.'
Primary KPI is an 18% sales lift on bundled starter kits within six weeks of launch.
Budget flexibility exists if the concept proves it can drive bundle sales via paid social.
Aurora wants to unlock an emotional hook around 'refresh your home mood effortlessly.'
Primary KPI is an 18% sales lift on bundled starter kits within six weeks of launch.
Budget flexibility exists if the concept proves it can drive bundle sales via paid social.

questions.prompt: Which audience segment is most valuable for bundle upsell: new homeowners or renters?
What budget ceiling should we assume when crafting hero concepts?
questions.answer: Client approved $650k with headroom if we prove paid social lift.

questions.prompt: Are there product mandatories beyond showcasing Aurora Glow presets?

summary: Aurora wants to unlock an emotional hook around 'refresh your home mood effortlessly.'
Primary KPI is an 18% sales lift on bundled starter kits within six weeks of launch.
answered: What budget ceiling should we assume when crafting hero concepts? → Client approved $650k with headroom if we prove paid social lift.

personas.name: Keisha, The Curated Host
personas.bio: Juggles a demanding job and social calendar. Wants effortless ways to make her home feel intentional.
goals: Host memorable gatherings with minimal prep.
Invest in tech that makes everyday rituals feel special.
Dial up pragmatic motivations in the launch storytelling.
painPoints: Feels overwhelmed by overly technical smart home setups.
Limited time to tweak lighting for different moods.
Skeptical about tech that requires constant app management.
personas.quote: If I can set the vibe with one voice command, I'm in.
anchors: Aurora wants to unlock an emotional hook around 'refresh your home mood effortlessly.'
What budget ceiling should we assume when crafting hero concepts? → Client approved $650k with headroom if we prove paid social lift.

personas.name: Elliot, The Practical Upgrader
personas.bio: Wants reliable smart tech that works in rentals without rewiring the space.
goals: Modernize the apartment without landlord complications.
Buy from brands that stand behind their warranties.
painPoints: No desire to learn complex smart home ecosystems.
Frustrated by products that require permanent installation.
Needs clear ROI on any premium purchase.
personas.quote: Smart lighting should be smarter about real-life apartments.
anchors: Primary KPI is an 18% sales lift on bundled starter kits within six weeks of launch.
What budget ceiling should we assume when crafting hero concepts? → Client approved $650k with headroom if we prove paid social lift.

prompts.label: Competitor Angle Sweep
prompts.promptText:
You are a strategist. Review the following brief summary and outline how top smart lighting competitors talk about seasonal refresh. Highlight tone, offer structure, and visual cues.

{{briefSummary}}

prompts.label: Persona Voice Stress-Test
prompts.promptText: Given the Aurora Spring Launch creative brief, propose three narrative hooks that would resonate with pragmatic renters focused on flexible living.

prompts.label: Paid Social Angles
prompts.promptText: From the creative brief objectives, produce five paid social narrative angles that connect effortless mood shifts with measurable outcomes.

watch.label: Brief Change Watcher
watch.description: Alerts Concept Studio when objectives or audience fields are updated.

artifact.name: Concept Boards
artifact.summary: Concept A is nearing sign-off; Concept B needs new setting exploration.

steps.notes: Concept shortlist prepared for Monday critique session.
steps.next: Run AI critique once the intake summary is updated.

steps.name: AI Creative Director
steps.description: Stress-test each concept board before it goes in front of the client.
steps.aiSupport: Provides constructive critique and anticipates client pushback.
steps.humanFocus: Integrate feedback, duplicate versions, and prep talking points.
steps.next: Queue after Concept Explorer outputs v2.

artifact.name: Shooting Script
artifact.summary: Awaiting approved concept to start scripting.

steps.description: Lay out the scene-by-scene roadmap before diving into dialogue.
steps.aiSupport: Suggests pacing adjustments and coverage notes.
steps.humanFocus: Lock structure and confirm pacing with stakeholders.

steps.name: Draft & Iterate
steps.description: Draft the script, run targeted rewrites, and capture revision history.
steps.aiSupport: Supports punch-ups, tonal rewrites, and production cue insertion.
steps.humanFocus: Approve final lines, mark revisions, and log change rationale.

notes.text: Kickoff complete. Client aligning on seasonal campaign look & feel next week.
Budget flexibility confirmed up to $650k pending paid social forecast.

projects.name: Northpeak Spring Campaign
projects.summary: Launch integrated storytelling that positions Northpeak as the trusted gear for ambitious beginners tackling their first peak season.

artifact.name: Creative Brief
artifact.summary: First draft aligning objectives with outdoor retailer partnerships is in review.

steps.description: Upload call notes, emails, and transcripts so the AI can highlight the throughline.
steps.aiSupport: Parses raw sources into a structured summary and flags inconsistencies.
steps.humanFocus: Capture every source, tag it, and sanity-check the generated outline.

sources.title: Kickoff Workshop
sources.summary: Client wants to celebrate newcomers to hiking without alienating core enthusiasts.
sources.contentPreview: Need episodic storytelling that scales across TikTok and email onboarding.
sources.raw: Need episodic storytelling that scales across TikTok and email onboarding.

sources.title: Retail Partner Goals
sources.summary: Shared co-op expectations and success metrics for sell-in packages.
sources.contentPreview: Target 12% lift in starter bundles, with spotlight on sustainability credentials.
sources.raw: Target 12% lift in starter bundles, with spotlight on sustainability credentials.

sources.title: Community Pulse Board
sources.summary: Social listening shows growing interest in approachable alpine content.
sources.contentPreview: Beginners want gear that feels premium but not intimidating.
sources.raw: Beginners want gear that feels premium but not intimidating.

summary: Northpeak needs to champion first-time hikers with approachable expertise and visible social proof.
Retail partners want sell-in packages ready by mid-May with measurable bundle incentives.
Product team can flex biodegradable materials narrative if we supply consumer-friendly language.
Northpeak needs to champion first-time hikers with approachable expertise and visible social proof.
Retail partners want sell-in packages ready by mid-May with measurable bundle incentives.
Product team can flex biodegradable materials narrative if we supply consumer-friendly language.

questions.prompt: Which sustainability proof points resonate most with first-time hikers?
What training or incentives will retail associates receive alongside the campaign launch?
Do we have flexibility to test paid creator partnerships in July?
questions.answer: Marketing approved a $40k test provided we deliver two hero stories by late May.

persona-builder.lastGuidance: Keep personas welcoming for first-time hikers while reinforcing sustainability proof.

summary: Northpeak needs to champion first-time hikers with approachable expertise and visible social proof.
Retail partners want sell-in packages ready by mid-May with measurable bundle incentives.
answered: Do we have flexibility to test paid creator partnerships in July? → Marketing approved a $40k test provided we deliver two hero stories by late May.

personas.name: Avery, The First Summit Planner
personas.bio: Balances a demanding job with a goal to complete her first 3-day hike this summer.
goals: Find reliable starter kits without feeling overwhelmed by tech specs.
Learn from relatable creators that make alpine travel feel achievable.
Keep sustainability proof simple enough to share with friends.
painPoints: Unsure which sustainability claims actually matter.
Limited time to compare gear bundles.
personas.quote: Show me a kit that helps me feel confident and prepared, not like an impostor.
anchors: Northpeak needs to champion first-time hikers with approachable expertise and visible social proof.
Do we have flexibility to test paid creator partnerships in July? → Marketing approved a $40k test provided we deliver two hero stories by late May.

personas.name: Mateo, The Community Organizer
personas.bio: Plans monthly hikes for new members and wants inclusive gear recs to share.
goals: Equip newcomers with dependable starter packs.
Highlight brands that invest in environmental stewardship.
Deliver bundle recommendations that satisfy retail partners' expectations.
painPoints: Needs clear bundle pricing he can confidently recommend.
Skeptical of greenwashing and vague material claims.
Seeks assets he can easily share in newsletters.
personas.quote: Give me something that keeps our club safe and proves we picked the right partner.
anchors: Retail partners want sell-in packages ready by mid-May with measurable bundle incentives.
Do we have flexibility to test paid creator partnerships in July? → Marketing approved a $40k test provided we deliver two hero stories by late May.

prompts.label: Onboarding Story Angles
prompts.promptText: Using the Northpeak brief summary, outline three narrative angles that welcome first-time hikers and show how gear lowers the barrier to entry.

prompts.label: Retail Partner Messaging
prompts.promptText: Draft talking points retail associates can use to pitch the Northpeak starter bundle, drawing from our sustainability proof points.

watch.label: Sustainability Updates
watch.description: Flag Concept Studio when sustainability claims or proof points change.
